messages.content: Hello, In this part of the interview process we will start with your resume round. Are you ready?
sure
Can you introduce yourself?
My name is Hridayesh Bajaj. How do you do?
Please stay focused on the interview.
My bad
Please continue with the previous question - Can you introduce yourself?
I am an avid coder and love problem solving.
Could you elaborate more on this?
I have recently graduated with a degress in computer science. I live in Mumbai and I believe that my skills will be very useful to the company.
Good to know that, Hridayesh. I could not find any project in you resume. Could you tell me more about your experience at AMAZON?
I Worked on the end to end automation at Amazon.
Could you elaborate more on this?

I was part of the team Automating the Infra supply chain for Amazon Web Services. I Worked on the end to end automation of orders for Servers, Racks and Power from manufacturing the racks to delivering it to AWS Data Centres.
Great, Hridayesh. Could you tell me how did you implement the automation part for servers?
Sure, tech Stack included JAVA, springBoot, yml, AWS services like cloudwatch, cloudformation, s3, Batch.
Your answer is not satisfactory. Please try again.
My tech Stack included JAVA, springBoot, yml, AWS services like cloudwatch, cloudformation, s3, Batch.
Your answer is not satisfactory. Please try again.
No clue
Shall we move ahead?
Sure.
Okay, Hridayesh. Moving on to the next question. I can see that you've mentioned JAVA as your skill. Could you tell me more about it?
Let's skip to the next question.

Okay, Hridayesh. This question is being skipped. Apart from the security aspect, give one reason behind making strings immutable in Java?What if I write static public void instead of public static void in Java, what would happen?
The program will compile and run correctly because the order of specifiers don't matter in Java.
Good, Hridayesh. Moving on to the next question. Why is Java a platform independent language?

Java language was developed so that it does not depend on any hardware or software because the compiler compiles the code and then converts it to platform-independent byte code which can be run on multiple systems.
Nice, Hridayesh. Moving on to the next question. I can see that you've mentioned s3 as your skill. Could you tell me more about it?
I don't know
Shall we move ahead?
No idea
You could answer this question or move ahead.
Okay, let's move ahead then.
Okay, Hridayesh. Moving on to the next question. What are the key components of Amazon S3?
Bucket is a key component.
Your answer is not satisfactory. Please try again.
Buckets, Objects, Keys, Regions, Endpoints, and Access Control Lists (ACLs) are key components.
Okay, Hridayesh. What is a bucket in S3?
A bucket is a container for objects stored in Amazon S3. It is similar to a folder and must have a globally unique name.
Nice, Hridayesh. Moving on to the next question. What is a bucket policy in S3?
No clue
Shall we move ahead?
Definitely
Okay, Hridayesh. Moving on to the next question. Explain ACLs in S3.
I don't remember the answer
Shall we move ahead?
Hmm
You could answer this question or move ahead.
I will answer.
Go ahead.
Access Control Lists (ACLs) are used to manage access to buckets and objects by controlling who can perform which actions (read/write/delete) on them.
Impressive, Hridayesh. Thank you for your time. You can click on exit to leave this interview. We will get back to you soon.
yes, thank you for your time.
You will be able to see the results as well as the feedback on EvaluAItor dashboard. Goodbye and have a good day ahead.
